page.title: 18SUGAR BEET RESEARCH STATION
page.content: It took a short time to get to Bush Johnson's research station.It is a large laboratory where experiments are done on sugar beet to improve its quality and quantity.On arrival we went to the secretary's office who telephoned for the boss.We went to a room and asked questions.After that we had drinks and biscuits and then we were shown the sugar beet.In the various greenhouses we saw sugar beet growing at different stages.Half the sugar we eat is produced from beet and the rest is sugar cane.We had a look at the Company's computer room before we went back to school. The name of the Company comes from a Polish gentleman called Bushinski who originally owned the laboratories. It was shortened to Bush and Johnson was added to make it sound more English.
